title: Warm Ricotta in Fresh Tomato Sauce
titleAlternative: Ricotta Calda in Salsa di Pomodori Freschi
introduction: Warm, creamy ricotta nestled in a fresh, tangy tomato sauce is a delightful starter inspired by a beloved Italian restaurant. The texture and flavor of sheep's milk ricotta elevate this dish, but cow's milk ricotta works beautifully as well.
ingredients: 8 ripe plum tomatoes, peeled, seeded, and chopped
6 fresh basil leaves, torn into bits

instructions.description: In a medium saucepan, combine the tomatoes, oil, salt, and red pepper. Bring to a simmer. Cook until the tomatoes are just softened, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Add half the basil leaves.
In a medium bowl, whisk the ricotta with the remaining basil, and salt and pepper to taste.
Spread the tomato sauce on 4 small plates or shallow bowls. With an ice cream scoop, shape the ricotta mixture into 4 balls and place them on top of the sauce. Serve warm.
